overview.description: Configure and maintain foundational reference data that powers the entire system
overview.whatItDoes: Manage lookup tables for legal authorities, judges, contacts, employees, statutory deadlines, and other reference data
overview.whyItMatters: Master data is the foundation of system accuracy. Incorrect master data causes errors in case management, deadline calculations, document generation, and compliance.
overview.criticalNote: Changes to master data affect ALL cases and operations. Proceed with caution.

manage-legal-authorities.title: Manage Legal Authorities
manage-legal-authorities.description: Configure courts, tribunals, and quasi-judicial bodies where cases are filed
steps: Click '+ Add Authority' to create new
Select authority type (Court, Tribunal, Commission, etc.)
Enter name, code, jurisdiction, and level
Set officer designations for this authority type
tips: Set jurisdiction correctly for case routing
Link matter types that apply to each authority
warnings: Deactivating an authority hides it from new cases but preserves existing links
Authority hierarchy affects statutory deadline calculations

manage-judges.title: Manage Judges/Officers
manage-judges.description: Maintain directory of judicial officers for hearing assignments
steps: Click '+ Add Judge' to create new
Enter name, designation, and authority assignment
tips: Update judge assignments when benches change
Historical records help with past case research
Designation affects how name appears in documents
warnings: Do not delete retired judges - mark as Retired to preserve case history

manage-employees.title: Manage Employees
manage-employees.description: Configure team members for case assignments and access control
steps: Click '+ Add Employee' to create new
Enter name, email, phone, and designation
Select employee type (Advocate, CA, Staff, Partner, etc.)
warnings: Deactivating employees immediately revokes system access
Cases assigned to deactivated employees need reassignment
manage-employees.securityNote: Employee configuration directly affects system access - review carefully

manage-statutory-deadlines.title: Configure Statutory Deadlines
manage-statutory-deadlines.description: Set up event types and calculation rules for automatic deadline tracking
steps: Click '+ Add Event Type' to create new deadline category
Enter event code, name, and description
Define default days, extension limits, and warning thresholds
Link to task templates for auto-creation
warnings: Incorrect deadline rules affect compliance for ALL cases
Changes apply to new cases only - existing deadlines preserve original rules
manage-statutory-deadlines.criticalImportance: Statutory deadline misconfiguration is a major compliance risk. Double-verify rules with legal team.

manage-contacts.title: Manage External Contacts
manage-contacts.description: Maintain directory of external parties, advocates, and consultants
steps: Click '+ Add Contact' to create new
Select contact type (Opposing Counsel, Expert, Consultant, etc.)
Link to clients or cases if applicable
tips: Link contacts to relevant cases for quick access
Keep contact info current for effective communication

import-master-data.title: Bulk Import Master Data
import-master-data.description: Import master records from Excel or CSV for initial setup or updates
tips: Back up existing data before large imports
warnings: Import errors can corrupt master data - use staging environment first

export-master-data.title: Export Master Data
export-master-data.description: Download master records for backup, analysis, or migration
steps: Navigate to the master data table
tips: Excel preserves formatting, CSV is system-agnostic

qualityRules: All master records must have unique codes
Descriptions should be meaningful for end-user clarity
Changes must be reviewed by designated data stewards

stewardship.manager: Create and update, submit for approval
stewardship.staff: View only, suggest changes via requests

commonMistakes.mistake: Creating duplicate master records with slight variations
commonMistakes.impact: Inconsistent data across cases, reporting errors
commonMistakes.prevention: Search before creating, use merge tools for duplicates

commonMistakes.mistake: Deleting master records instead of deactivating
commonMistakes.impact: Broken references in historical cases, audit trail gaps
commonMistakes.prevention: Always deactivate, never delete production master data

commonMistakes.mistake: Changing master codes after records are in use
commonMistakes.impact: Broken integrations, report failures, data corruption
commonMistakes.prevention: Codes are immutable once created - create new record if needed

commonMistakes.mistake: Not testing statutory deadline rules before production
commonMistakes.impact: Incorrect deadlines calculated for cases, compliance violations
commonMistakes.prevention: Test all calculation rules in staging, verify with legal team

staff.access: View only for most master data
staff.tips: Report data issues to your manager

manager.access: Create and edit non-critical master data
manager.actions: Cannot modify employees or statutory deadlines
manager.tips: Maintain quality within your area, escalate complex changes

admin.access: Full access to all master data
admin.actions: All CRUD operations, can approve imports
admin.tips: Review all changes carefully, maintain audit documentation

implementor.tips: Document all configurations, train admins before handoff

faqs.question: Can I undo a master data change?
faqs.answer: Use the audit log to see previous values. For critical data, request admin restore from backup. System doesn't support automatic undo.

faqs.question: Why can't I delete a master record?
faqs.answer: Records linked to cases cannot be deleted to preserve data integrity. Deactivate instead to hide from new selections while preserving history.

faqs.question: How do I merge duplicate master records?
faqs.answer: Contact admin. The process involves updating all references to the primary record, then deactivating the duplicate. Cannot be automated.
